column4: I upgraded to grub2, and everything worked fine until I did the upgrade-grub-from-legacy command.  Now grub gives me an error 15./  I assume that something is misconfigured.  I am using a livecd right now.  Can someone please help me configure grub so that I can boot from my hd?
When you upgraded to grub2 was there any prompt?
You needed to select your hard drive so that grub2 would be installed to the master boot record, you can do that from the LiveCD to fix it

Boot into a liveCD, mount your Ubuntu partition to /mnt ( or replace /mnt with whatever your mountpoint is ) and then run: "sudo mount -o bind /dev /mnt/dev && sudo mount -o bind /proc /mnt/proc && sudo mount -o bind /sys /mnt/sys && sudo chroot /mnt dpkg-reconfigure grub-pc"
ok, thanks.  I'll give that a try.
ok, I tried and I get "chroot: cannot run command 'dpkg-reconfigure': Exec format error"
You have 64 bit Ubuntu installed but 32 bit liveCD
so I need to try using a 64 bit live cd?  or is there no other way?
To fix grub instead run "sudo grub install /dev/sda1 --root-directory=/mnt" then be sure to run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure grub-pc" once you are booted into your system
Sorry, typo
Should be "sudo grub-install /dev/sda --root-directory=/mnt"
ok, where /dev/sda should be my 9.10 partition?  in my case, sda5 right?
No, it's referring to the entire drive, not a single partition
ok
ok, I was able to boot into my 9.10 partition.  so far so good, not I ran dpkg-reconfigure grub-pc and it is asking me to confirm the parameters.  is there anything I should be concerned with here?
Press space bar to select your drive

the parameters it is asking me for are "vga=795" and "quiet splash".  after I confirm these, the screen exits and I get an error: "mktemp: failed to create file via template `/tmp/grub.XXXXXXXXXX': Invalid argument"
If you run "echo $?" right after the dpkg-reconfigure command what does it output?
ok, I ran echo $? and it just displays "1"
Try running "sudo dpkg --configure -a"
ok, now should I try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure grub-pc"?
No, now you're done
oh, ok.  thanks very much for your help
np
